title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement hello@dalyanalytics.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jasmine Daly. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Daly J (2025). shinyfa: Analyze File Contents Shiny Directories. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/dalyanalytics/shinyfa.
code: @Manual{,   title = {shinyfa: Analyze the File Contents of Shiny Directories},   author = {Jasmine Daly},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/dalyanalytics/shinyfa}, }

what: Easily analyze the file contents of Shiny apps
title: Easily analyze the file contents of Shiny apps
text: shinyfa package designed help Shiny developers analyze understand file contents large Shiny app directories. Large Shiny applications often contain numerous files define dynamic UI server components, sometimes linked together complex sourcing chains (though less common Shiny apps structured modules). new contributors—consultants joining project—can take considerable time onboard, navigate codebase, identify areas optimization. -progress package aims streamline process extracting key information Shiny app directory. identifies specific render functions, reactive functions, inputs, organizing structured data.frame easy reference. fa shinyfa stands file analysis.

title: Easily analyze the file contents of Shiny apps
text: can install development version {shinyfa} GitHub :

title: Easily analyze the file contents of Shiny apps
text: basic example shows solve common problem looping directory contains server files:
code: library(shinyfa) library(dplyr)    file_path_df <- list.files("SHINY-SERVER-DIRECTORY",                             pattern = "\\.R$", full.names = TRUE)  file_analysis <- data.frame()  # Initialize an empty dataframe  for (file in file_path_df) {   shiny_analysis <- analyze_shiny_reactivity(file_path = file)      # Skip if NULL (empty file or only `source()` calls)   if (is.null(shiny_analysis)) next      # Add filename column   shiny_analysis$file_name <- basename(file)      # Bind results   file_analysis <- bind_rows(file_analysis, shiny_analysis) }  print(file_analysis)

what: Analyze Shiny server reactivity in a given file — analyze_shiny_reactivity
title: Analyze Shiny server reactivity in a given file — analyze_shiny_reactivity
text: function processes Shiny server script, identifying render functions, reactivity types, input dependencies.

title: Analyze Shiny server reactivity in a given file — analyze_shiny_reactivity
Analyze Shiny server reactivity in a given file — analyze_shiny_reactivity
text: file_path string representing path R file.

title: Analyze Shiny server reactivity in a given file — analyze_shiny_reactivity
text: data frame summarizing reactivity structure file.

what: Classify the reactivity type of a render block — classify_reactivity
title: Classify the reactivity type of a render block — classify_reactivity
text: Determines whether given block Shiny code contains reactive elements reactive(), eventReactive(), observeEvent(), etc.

title: Classify the reactivity type of a render block — classify_reactivity
Classify the reactivity type of a render block — classify_reactivity
text: render_block character vector representing block Shiny server code.

title: Classify the reactivity type of a render block — classify_reactivity
text: string indicating type reactivity detected.

what: Extract input dependencies from a Shiny render block — extract_input_dependencies
title: Extract input dependencies from a Shiny render block — extract_input_dependencies
text: Identifies input$ dependencies within render block, including cases like input$var input[['var']].

title: Extract input dependencies from a Shiny render block — extract_input_dependencies
Extract input dependencies from a Shiny render block — extract_input_dependencies
text: render_block character vector representing block Shiny server code.

title: Extract input dependencies from a Shiny render block — extract_input_dependencies
text: string unique input IDs used within render block, "None" inputs found.

what: Extract named reactive expressions from a Shiny server file — extract_named_reactives
title: Extract named reactive expressions from a Shiny server file — extract_named_reactives
text: Identifies reactive() assignments stored variables returns data frame. Additionally, checks input dependencies inside reactive() function.

title: Extract named reactive expressions from a Shiny server file — extract_named_reactives
Extract named reactive expressions from a Shiny server file — extract_named_reactives
text: server_code character vector representing lines Shiny server code.

title: Extract named reactive expressions from a Shiny server file — extract_named_reactives
text: data frame containing named reactive expressions corresponding input dependencies.

what: Extract output assignments from Shiny server code — extract_output_assignments
title: Extract output assignments from Shiny server code — extract_output_assignments
text: Identifies output$ assignments Shiny server file extracts associated render function types.

title: Extract output assignments from Shiny server code — extract_output_assignments
Extract output assignments from Shiny server code — extract_output_assignments
text: server_code character vector representing lines Shiny server code.

title: Extract output assignments from Shiny server code — extract_output_assignments
text: list lists, list contains index, output ID, render function type.

what: Extract Shiny UI input and output elements and their ids (including custom Output functions) — extract_ui_features
title: Extract Shiny UI input and output elements and their ids (including custom Output functions) — extract_ui_features
text: function identifies Shiny input functions (e.g., selectInput, textInput, numericInput) output functions (e.g., plotOutput, tableOutput, custom output functions) UI script, extracts corresponding ids. skips lines source() calls.

title: Extract Shiny UI input and output elements and their ids (including custom Output functions) — extract_ui_features
Extract Shiny UI input and output elements and their ids (including custom Output functions) — extract_ui_features
text: ui_code character vector representing lines Shiny UI code.

title: Extract Shiny UI input and output elements and their ids (including custom Output functions) — extract_ui_features
text: data frame containing input/output functions associated ids.

what: Read a Shiny file and determine if it should be skipped — read_shiny_file
title: Read a Shiny file and determine if it should be skipped — read_shiny_file
text: function reads Shiny server file checks whether contains source() calls empty. , returns NULL indicate file skipped.

title: Read a Shiny file and determine if it should be skipped — read_shiny_file
Read a Shiny file and determine if it should be skipped — read_shiny_file
text: file_path string representing path R file.

title: Read a Shiny file and determine if it should be skipped — read_shiny_file
text: character vector containing file's lines valid, otherwise NULL.
